data.enText: a short journey made for pleasure, especially one that has been organized for a group of people
They've gone on an excursion to York.
a short period of trying a new or different activity

data.chText: 他短暂涉猎过戏剧之后便把全部精力投入到他的主要兴趣——诗歌中去了。
data.enText: After a brief excursion into drama, he concentrated on his main interest, which was poetry.

data.text: trip ♦ journey ♦ tour ♦ expedition ♦ excursion ♦ outing ♦ day out

data.chText: 以上各词均指旅行、旅游。
data.enText: These are all words for an act of travelling to a place.
trip
an act of travelling from one place to another, and usually back again
a business trip
a five-minute trip by taxi
journey
an act of travelling from one place to another, especially when they are a long way apart

data.chText: 漫长而艰难的翻山旅行
data.enText: a long and difficult journey across the mountains

data.chText: trip为本组词中最基础的词，journey则不是。trip较journey常用，用于较广的语境。trip通常为往返旅行，journey通常为单程旅行。trip的行程常较journey短，尽管不一定如此：
data.enText: Trip , not journey , is the most basic word in this group. It is more frequent than journey and used in a wider range of contexts. A trip usually involves you going to a place and back again; a journey is usually one-way. A trip is often shorter than a journey , although it does not have to be.
a trip to New York
a round-the-world trip

data.chText: 即使距离远，trip所花时间常常不长。如果旅程长且艰难较常用journey。在北美英语中，journey不用以指短途旅行：
data.enText: It is often short in time, even if it is long in distance. Journey is more often used when the travelling takes a long time and is difficult. In North American English journey is not used for short trips.
What is your journey to work like? ( BrE )
trip or journey?
tour

data.chText: 指游览多地的旅行、旅游：
data.enText: a journey made for pleasure during which several different places are visited
a tour of Bavaria
expedition
an organized journey with a particular purpose, especially to find out about a place that is not well known
the first expedition to the South Pole
excursion

data.chText: 尤指集体远足、短途旅行：
data.enText: a short trip made for pleasure, especially one that has been organized for a group of people

data.chText: 我们到岛上去游览了一整天。
data.enText: We went on an all-day excursion to the island.
outing

data.chText: 指集体出外游玩或学习，通常不超过一天：
data.enText: a short trip made for pleasure or education, usually with a group of people and lasting no more than a day

data.chText: 孩子们离校游览了一天。
data.enText: The children were on a day's outing from school.
day out
a trip to somewhere for a day, especially for pleasure
We had a day out at the beach.
to go on a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition/excursion/outing/day out
to set out/off on a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition/excursion
to make a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition/excursion
to be away on a(n) trip/journey/tour/expedition
the outward/return/homeward trip/journey
a(n) foreign/overseas/round-the-world trip/journey/tour/expedition
a bus/coach trip/journey/tour/excursion
a train/rail trip/journey/tour/excursion

simple_means.memory_skill: ex 出 + curs 跑，引申为“发生” + ion 表动作 → 跑出去 → 远足

tr: wandering from the main path of a journey

example: many summer excursions to the shore
it was merely a pleasure trip
after cautious sashays into the field

value.def: You can refer to a short journey as an excursion, especially if it is made for pleasure or enjoyment.

example.ex: In Bermuda, Sam's father took him on an excursion to a coral barrier.
example.tran: 在百慕大，萨姆的父亲带他到附近的珊瑚礁去游玩。

value.def: An excursion is a trip or visit to an interesting place, especially one that is arranged or recommended by a holiday company or tourist organization.

example.ex: We also recommend a full day optional excursion to the Upper Douro...
example.tran: 我们还推荐去杜罗河上游的短途自选一日游。

example.ex: Another pleasant excursion is Malaga, 18 miles away.
example.tran: 另一个非常不错的短途旅游是去18英里以外的马拉加。

value.tran: （尤指旅行社组织的）短途旅游

value.def: If you describe an activity as an excursion into something, you mean that it is an attempt to develop or understand something new that you have not experienced before.

example.ex: ...Radio 3's latest excursion into ethnic music, dance and literature...
example.tran: 第三广播台最近开始涉及有关少数民族音乐、舞蹈和文学的节目

example.ex: The few excursions into stylistic experiment do not entirely come off.
example.tran: 几次体裁上的尝试都不算很成功。

gramarinfo.label: usu N <l>into</l> n, oft poss N

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to run 跑 , 引申为“发生”
rootsaffixes.title: cur(r), curs, cour(i), cours

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 共同 + cours 跑，引申为“发生” + e → 汇合；合流
con 共同 + cur 跑，引申为“发生” → 同时发生
couri 跑，引申为“发生” + er 表名词 → 跑着〔送东西〕的人 → 信使
cours 跑，引申为“发生” + e → 跑的〔距离〕→ 路程
cours 跑，引申为“发生” + er 表动物 → 跑的动物 → 猎犬
cur〔e〕跑，引申为“发生” + able 可…的 → 能产生〔疗效〕→ 可治好的
cur〔e〕跑，引申为“发生” + ative 有…倾向（性质）的，属于…的 → 治病的，（药）有效的
cur 跑，引申为“发生” + ator 表人 → 跑来跑去〔照看展品〕的人 → 馆长
cur 跑，引申为“发生” + e → 跑来跑去〔给病人看病〕→ 治疗
curi 关心 + osity 表状态 → 好奇心
curi〔= cur〕跑，引申为“发生” + ous …的 → 跑过去〔看〕→ 好奇的
curr 跑，引申为“发生” + ency 表行为 → 跑来跑去 → 流传
curr 跑，引申为“发生” + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 跑的 → 流动的
curs 跑，引申为“发生” + ive …的 → 像跑一样快地〔写〕→ 草写
curs 跑，引申为“发生” + ory …的 → 随便跑过去 → 草率的
ex 出 + curs 跑，引申为“发生” + ion 表动作 → 跑出去 → 远足
ex 出 + curs 跑，引申为“发生” + ive …的 →〔思想〕跑出〔重心〕→ 离题的
in 使… + cur 跑，引申为“发生” → 使发生 → 招惹
in 使… + cur 跑，引申为“发生” + sion 表行为 → 侵犯
inter 在…之间 + course 路程；课程 → 在二者之间跑 → 交流
oc 加强 + cur 跑，引申为“发生” → 发生；出现
pre 前 + curs 跑，引申为“发生” + or 表人 → 跑在前面的人 → 先驱
procur〔e〕取得，获得 + able 可…的 → 可得到的
pro 在前 + cur 跑，引申为“发生” + e → 跑在前面〔拿〕→ 取得
re 回 + cours 跑，引申为“发生” + e → 跑回来 → 求助
re 重新 + cur 跑，引申为“发生” → 再发生；重现
se 分开 + cur 跑，引申为“发生” + e → 分开走 → 安全的
se 分开，离开 + cur 跑，引申为“发生” + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 安全；证券
suc 下 + cour 跑，引申为“发生” → 跑下去〔救援〕→ 救援人员
